docs.summary: Api for installation of apps, mainly from consent page

Generate a link to the user's Editor, and open app market to allow the user to add the app to the stage
 If this API is called by the browser in a full redirect (accept: text/html) then it will redirect to the resulted link
 Otherwise, it will return EditorDeepLinkResponse
Set of key-value pairs.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: headers
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: headers
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.

members.name: collectionsToken
members.doc: to be used by app-builder to allow installing collections when the app is installed

members.name: compType
members.doc: Enum of Component Type

members.name: compData
members.doc: Component data

members.name: compName
members.doc: required to all types except app studio

members.name: studioComponentData
members.doc: An extension to platform used by app studio UI

members.name: platformComponentData
members.doc:
A platform app is a new type of application that lives inside the editor.
It is built from native editor components such as buttons, input fields, and images, and it provides the user a native editing experience.

members.name: workerComponentData
members.doc:
a hidden iframe that allows you to run background Javascript on each page of the live site. This makes it possible for you to track site visitor activity and manage background tasks.
Since users can’t see this component, you need to combine it with a visible component, like a widget or dashboard page.
Example: Visitor Analytics app

members.name: dashboardComponentData
members.doc:
Dashboard page components provide users with a back office service to manage their business, site, contacts, communication with site visitors and more. This component isn’t part of the live site, so only Wix users can see it (not site visitors).
Example of a dashboard page app: Site Booster

members.name: widgetComponentData
members.doc:
a small element on the user’s site. You can choose to let users resize the widget and move it anywhere on the page, or set the widget to be pinned to a specific location on all pages.
Examples: Comments app and Tidio Live Chat app (a pinned widget)

members.name: pageComponentData
members.doc:
a page in the user’s site. The page appears in the main menu and behaves just like any other page in the site.  A page component can have internal pages, each with its own URL – so it’s ideal for apps that use deep linking (like a blog, forum, or eCommerce store).
Example: Wix Forum app

members.doc: If true, components of the app wont be added to the editor (only run editor sripts)

members.name: viewerVerboseScriptUrl
members.doc: Path to a Javascript file that viewer runs for page components / widgets and applicative business logic. Includes verbose logs for Wix runtime.

members.name: id
members.doc: app_def_id

members.name: version
members.doc: optional, will install latest published if not provided with version

members.name: shareUrlId
members.doc: optional, will forwarded to app-service to check if the requesting user is allowed to installed this app when the user isn't an owner OR this version isn't published

members.name: version
members.doc: version of the app that was eventually installed

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: will return only on responses, cannot be changed

members.name: requiredActions
members.doc: additional steps required to finish the installation of the app on the site

docs.summary:
Required steps could be the following:
OAUTH2 -> In thise case no link will return, the client will need to run finishInstallation method (described here) with parameters
EMBEDDED_SCRIPT -> No link will return, the client will need to use either api or the auto generated form to embed the parameters
EDITOR -> A link (with deeplink) to add the app to the site will be provided to the user's editor
DASHBOARD -> A link will be provided to either the user's BM inside the app (for an embedded dashboard) or to the developers dashboard url (for a none embeded dashboard)

members.name: errorCode
members.doc: error code of the error that was emitted (to be handled programmatically), check out errors.md to find out more

members.name: message
members.doc: full error message, mostly for logs

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • NONE_EXTENSION
  • PAYMENTS_GATEWAY_EXTENSION
  • COUPONS_EXTENSION
  • DROPSHIPPING_EXTENSION
  • FULFILMENT_EXTENSION
  • DROPSHIPPING_SUPPLIER_EXTENSION
  • FULFILLMENT_CENTER_EXTENSION
  • RESTAURANTS_POS_EXTENSION
  • ART_STORE_EXTENSION
  • ASCEND_AUTOMATION_EXTENSION
  • CONTACT_LABELS_EXTENSION

Possible values are:
  • NONE_VERTICAL
  • TOP
  • CENTER_VERTICAL
  • BOTTOM

Possible values are:
  • NONE_HORIZONTAL
  • LEFT
  • CENTER_HORIZONTAL
  • RIGHT

Possible values are:
  • NONE_TYPE
  • CUSTOM
  • FULL

Possible values are:
  • NONE_PAGES
  • ONCE
  • SPECIFIC_PAGES

Possible values are:
  • NONE_PLACEMENT
  • HEAD
  • BODY_START
  • BODY_END

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ESSENTIAL
  • FUNCTIONAL
  • ANALYTICS
  • ADVERTISING

Possible values are:
  • NONE
  • STUDIO
  • PLATFORM
  • WORKER
  • DASHBOARD
  • WIDGET
  • PAGE
  • DASHBOARD_PLATFORM
  • STUDIO_WIDGET
  • EMBEDDED_SCRIPT
  • EXTENSION
  • SNIPPET_SOLUTION
  • DATA_COMPONENT
  • WEB
  • DC_CONFIG
  • WIDGET_OUT_OF_IFRAME
  • PAGE_OUT_OF_IFRAME
  • STATIC_FILE
  • APP_CONFIG

Possible values are:
  • no_region
  • header
  • pageContainer
  • footer

Possible values are:
  • VIDEO
  • IMAGE
  • YOUTUBE

Possible values are:
  • NONE_VALUE
  • NEW_WINDOW
  • NEW_TAB

Possible values are:
  • NONE_ACTION
  • NO_ACTION
  • REMOVE_ALL_PRODUCT

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • VISIBLE
  • HIDDEN

Possible values are:
  • None
  • FREEMIUM
  • PREMIUM
  • FREE
  • WIX_PREMIUM

Possible values are:
  • NONE_STATUS - default, internal use status. do not use
  • DRAFT - a version which was created in the dev center and has not started the approval process yet
  • SUBMITTED - the version was submitted for review by the developer
  • IN_REVIEW - the version is being reviewed by the app market team in cactus
  • APPROVED - our team approved the version
  • PUBLISHED - this version is published - only one version can be published at any given time; if this app was already published, the previously published version's status is now ARCHIVED
  • DECLINED - our team did not accept this version of the app
  • ARCHIVED - the status for versions that are no longer relevant
  • HIDDEN - status for versions with no significant changes, e.g. for test app. for questions contact our team

Possible values are:
  • NO_ROLE - Not supported
  • OWNER - View, edit
  • DEVELOPER - Not supported
  • ADMIN - View, edit
  • GOD - App market teams role. Do not use.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • AUTO_RENEW_ON - Subscription renewed when current period ends with automatic payment method, for example credit card
  • AUTO_RENEW_OFF - Subscription is turned off at current period end date
  • MANUAL - Subscription is renewed when current period ends only if paid for manually

Possible values are:
  • EMPTY
  • INSTALLED - the app was installed on this meta site id
  • PENDING - meaning the app needs the user to finish the installation (for example add the app in the editor)

Possible values are:
  • NONE
  • OAUTH2
  • EMBEDDED_SCRIPT
  • EDITOR
  • DASHBOARD
